chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Devonte Delmontry Wilks.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the Court that discovery sent to defendant was returned by mail and requests additional time to provide discovery to client.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski appeared by video for Devonte Delmontry Wilks.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status conference.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court, defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks not in court, in custody.  
William R. F. Ackell for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ase in court for Scheduling Conference. However, the State advises the court and defense counsel this case was tabbed to Branch 19  in error.
This case belongs to Team 5. Court ordered matter transferred forthwith and schedule on Branch 2 calendar.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks in court by video with Attorney Andrew T Gawronski who appears in person.  Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Devonte Delmontry Wilks in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonte Delmontry Wilks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if hemeets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
